definition: to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste

sentences.english: In the neighboring room, the sound of iron articles being moved was audible.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁屋子里传来一阵翻动废铁的声音。

sentences.english: China remains very competitive in Al, zinc, scrap steel, pig iron.
sentences.chinese: 中国在铝，锌，废铁，球铁等有优势。

sentences.english: Scrap iron can be sold for money.
Turn it into a heap of metal.
Specialised in all kinds of scrap iron, cut length bar lorry service.
sentences.chinese: 专营新旧五金废铁，剪便长短花，圆铁支罗哩服务。

sentences.english: The car was a write- off after the accident.
sentences.chinese: 出事后，这辆汽车成了一堆废铁。

sentences.english: Those old railway carriages will be broken up for scrap .
sentences.chinese: 那些旧火车车厢将用来拆取废铁。

sentences.english: She had pulled an old sheet-iron stove from a corner, and she was rummaging among the old heap of iron.
sentences.chinese: 她从屋角里拖出一个旧铁皮炉子，又去翻动一堆废铁。

sentences.english: The old ship was towed away to be broken up and sold as scrap.
sentences.chinese: 那艘旧船被拖走以便拆散当废铁卖了。

sentences.english: In one corner lay some ironmongery of dubious aspect.
sentences.chinese: 几根形相可疑的废铁件堆在一个角落里。

sentences.english: The magnet crane moves scrap iron from piles into trucks.
sentences.chinese: 磁力起重机把废铁从废铁堆里吊起来装进卡车。

sentences.english: The magnet crane moves scrap iron from piles into trucks.
sentences.chinese: 磁力起重机把废铁从废铁堆里吊起来装进卡车。

definition: same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
